title: Go Logical Operators

metadata.description: Learn about Go Logical Operators with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Logical Operators
Logical operators are used to determine the logic between variables or values:
Operator
Name
Description
Example
Try it
&&
Logical and
Returns true if both statements are true
x < 5 &&  x < 10
Try it »
||
Logical or
Returns true if one of the statements is true
x < 5 || x < 4
Try it »
!
Logical not
Reverse the result, returns false if the result is true
!(x < 5 && x < 10)
Try it »

★
+1

practice_exercises.title: Practice Exercise
practice_exercises.description: Create an example that applies the concepts from this tutorial.

summary: This tutorial covers Go Logical Operators concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use Go Logical Operators effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of Go Logical Operators and how to apply it in your projects.
